Structs/KafkaError.html#/s:10SwiftKafka0.name: init(rawValue:)
Structs/KafkaError.html#/s:10SwiftKafka0.abstract: Create a KafkaError from an rdKafka error code.

Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html#/s:10Sw.name: value
Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html#/s:10Sw.abstract: The message value if it can be utf8 decoded to a String.

Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html#/s:10Sw.name: key
Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html#/s:10Sw.abstract: The message key if it can be utf8 decoded to a String.

Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html#/s:10Sw.name: topic
Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html#/s:10Sw.abstract: The topic that the message was consumed from.

Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html#/s:10Sw.name: partition
Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html#/s:10Sw.abstract: The partition that the message was consumed from.

Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html.name: KafkaConsumerRecord
Structs/KafkaConsumerRecord.html.abstract: The message returned by a KafkaConsumer polling a broker.

Structs/KafkaError.html.name: KafkaError
Structs/KafkaError.html.abstract: Representation of errors that can be thrown by KituraKafka.

Structs/KafkaProducerRecord.html.name: KafkaProducerRecord
Structs/KafkaProducerRecord.html.abstract: The messages that can be sent by a KafkaProducer.

Classes/KafkaProducer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.name: init(config:pollInterval:)
Classes/KafkaProducer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.abstract: Create a new KafkaProducer for sending messages to Kafka.

Classes/KafkaConsumer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.name: subscribe(topics:)
Classes/KafkaConsumer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.abstract: Subscribe to one or more topics. The consumer will be assigned partitions based on its consumer group.

Classes/KafkaConsumer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.name: assign(topic:partition:offset:)
Classes/KafkaConsumer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.abstract: Assign this consumer to a single topic with a specified partition to consume from.

Classes/KafkaConsumer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.name: poll(timeout:)
Classes/KafkaConsumer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.abstract: Consume messages from the topic you are subscribed to.

Classes/KafkaConsumer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.name: commitSync()
Classes/KafkaConsumer.html#/s:10SwiftKaf.abstract: Commit the offsets for the current partition assignment on the broker.

Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.name: smallest
Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.abstract: Automatically reset the offset to the smallest offset.

Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.name: earliest
Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.abstract: Automatically reset the offset to the smallest offset.

Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.name: beginning
Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.abstract: Automatically reset the offset to the smallest offset.

Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.name: largest
Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.abstract: Automatically reset the offset to the largest offset

Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.name: latest
Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.abstract: Automatically reset the offset to the largest offset

Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.name: end
Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.abstract: Automatically reset the offset to the largest offset

Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.name: error
Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.abstract: Trigger an error which is retrieved by consuming message.

Classes/KafkaConfig/SecurityProtocol.htm.name: plaintext
Classes/KafkaConfig/SecurityProtocol.htm.abstract: Don’t use a protocol and send messages in plaintext.

Classes/KafkaConfig/SecurityProtocol.htm.name: sasl_plaintext
Classes/KafkaConfig/SecurityProtocol.htm.abstract: Use the Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) without SSL.

Classes/KafkaConfig/SecurityProtocol.htm.name: sasl_ssl
Classes/KafkaConfig/SecurityProtocol.htm.abstract: Use the Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) with SSL.

Classes/KafkaConfig/IPAddressFamily.html.name: description
Classes/KafkaConfig/IPAddressFamily.html.abstract: The textual representation of the IP address family.

Classes/KafkaConfig/DebugOptions.html#/s.name: description
Classes/KafkaConfig/DebugOptions.html#/s.abstract: The textual representation of the debug option

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: dictionary
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: The internal representation of the Kafka configuration.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: init()
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Initialize a KafkaConfig instance with default settings.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Directly set the configuration settings for librdKafka.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: clientID
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Client identifier. Defaults to rdkafka.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: messageMaxBytes
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Maximum Kafka protocol request message size. Defaults to 1000000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: messageCopyMaxBytes
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Maximum size for message to be copied to buffer. Messages larger than this will be passed by reference (zero-copy) at the expense of larger iovecs. Defaults to 65535.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: receiveMessageMaxBytes
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Maximum Kafka protocol response message size. This serves as a safety precaution to avoid memory exhaustion in case of protocol hickups. This value must be at least fetchMaxBytes + 512 to allow for protocol overhead; the value is adjusted automatically unless the configuration property is explicitly set. Defaults to 100000000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: maxInFlightRequestsPerConnection
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Maximum number of in-flight requests per broker connection. This is a generic property applied to all broker communication, however it is primarily relevant to produce requests. In particular, note that other mechanisms limit the number of outstanding consumer fetch request per broker to one. Defaults to 1000000

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: metadataRequestTimeoutMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Non-topic request timeout in milliseconds. This is for metadata requests, etc. Defaults to 60000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: topicMetadataRefreshIntervalMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Topic metadata refresh interval in milliseconds. The metadata is automatically refreshed on error and connect. Use -1 to disable the intervalled refresh. Defaults to 300000

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: metadataMaxAgeMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Metadata cache max age. Defaults to topic.metadata.refresh.interval.ms * 3

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: topicMetadataRefreshFastIntervalMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: When a topic loses its leader a new metadata request will be enqueued with this initial interval, exponentially increasing until the topic metadata has been refreshed. This is used to recover quickly from transitioning leader brokers. Defaults to 250.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: topicMetadataRefreshSparse
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Sparse metadata requests (consumes less network bandwidth). Defaults to true.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: debug
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: An array of debug contexts to enable. Defaults to an empty array.

Classes/KafkaConfig/DebugOptions.html.name: DebugOptions
Classes/KafkaConfig/DebugOptions.html.abstract: The possible debug options that can be enabled.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: socketTimeoutMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Default timeout for network requests.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: socketSendBufferBytes
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Broker socket send buffer size. System default is used if 0. Defaults to 0.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: socketReceiveBufferBytes
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Broker socket receive buffer size. System default is used if 0. Defaults to 0.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: socketKeepaliveEnable
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Enable TCP keep-alives (SO_KEEPALIVE) on broker sockets. Defaults to false

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: socketNagleDisable
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Disable the Nagle algorithm (TCP_NODELAY) on broker sockets.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: socketMaxFails
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Disconnect from broker when this number of send failures (e.g., timed out requests) is reached. Disable with 0. WARNING: It is highly recommended to leave this setting at its default value of 1 to avoid the client and broker to become desynchronized in case of request timeouts. NOTE: The connection is automatically re-established.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: brokerAddressFamily
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Allowed broker IPAddressFamily (any, IPv4, IPv6). Defaults to any.

Classes/KafkaConfig/IPAddressFamily.html.name: IPAddressFamily
Classes/KafkaConfig/IPAddressFamily.html.abstract: The possible IP address family options that can be set.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: reconnectBackoffMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: The initial time to wait before reconnecting to a broker after the connection has been closed. The time is increased exponentially until reconnect.backoff.max.ms is reached. -25% to +50% jitter is applied to each reconnect backoff. A value of 0 disables the backoff and reconnects immediately. Defaults to 100.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: reconnectBackoffMaxMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: The maximum time to wait before reconnecting to a broker after the connection has been closed. Defaults to 10000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: securityProtocol
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: The SecurityProtocol used to communicate with brokers.

Classes/KafkaConfig/SecurityProtocol.htm.name: SecurityProtocol
Classes/KafkaConfig/SecurityProtocol.htm.abstract: The possible security protocols that can be used to communicate with brokers.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: sslKeyLocation
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Path to client’s private key (PEM) used for authentication. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: sslKeyPassword
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Private key passphrase. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: sslCertificateLocation
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Path to client’s public key (PEM) used for authentication. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: sslCaLocation
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: File or directory path to CA certificate(s) for verifying the broker’s key. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: sslCrlLocation
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Path to CRL for verifying broker’s certificate validity. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: sslKeystoreLocation
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Path to client’s keystore (PKCS#12) used for authentication. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: sslKeystorePassword
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Client’s keystore (PKCS#12) password. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: saslMechanism
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: SASL mechanism to use for authentication. Defaults to GSSAPI.

Classes/KafkaConfig/SASLMechanism.html.name: SASLMechanism
Classes/KafkaConfig/SASLMechanism.html.abstract: The possible SASL mechanisms that can be used for authentication.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: saslUsername
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: SASL username for use with the PLAIN, SCRAM-SHA-256 and SCRAM-SHA-512 mechanisms. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: saslPassword
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: SASL password for use with the PLAIN, SCRAM-SHA-256 and SCRAM-SHA-512 mechanisms. Defaults to nil.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: groupId
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer Only. Client group id string. All clients sharing the same group.id belong to the same group and the messages will be split between them. Defaults to nil, meaning a random UUID String will be used as the groupId.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: sessionTimeoutMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer Only. Client group session and failure detection timeout. The consumer sends periodic heartbeats (heartbeat.interval.ms) to indicate its liveness to the broker. If no hearts are received by the broker for a group member within the session timeout, the broker will remove the consumer from the group and trigger a rebalance. Defaults to 10000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: heartbeatIntervalMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer Only. Group session keepalive heartbeat interval. Defaults to 3000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: maxPollIntervalMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer Only. Maximum allowed time between calls to consume messages (e.g., rd_kafka_consumer_poll()) for high-level consumers. If this interval is exceeded the consumer is considered failed and the group will rebalance in order to reassign the partitions to another consumer group member. Warning: Offset commits may be not possible at this point. Note: It is recommended to set enable.auto.offset.store=false for long-time processing applications and then explicitly store offsets (using offsets_store()) after message processing, to make sure offsets are not auto-committed prior to processing has finished. The interval is checked two times per second. Defaults to 300000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: enableAutoCommit
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer Only. Automatically and periodically commit offsets in the background. Note: setting this to false does not prevent the consumer from fetching previously committed start offsets. To circumvent this behaviour set specific start offsets per partition in the call to assign(). Defaults to true.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: autoCommitIntervalMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer Only. The frequency in milliseconds that the consumer offsets are committed (written) to offset storage. (0 = disable). Default to 5000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: enableAutoOffsetStore
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer Only. Automatically store offset of last message provided to application. The offset store is an in-memory store of the next offset to (auto-)commit for each partition. Defaults to true

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: enablePartitionEOF
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer Only. Emit RD_KAFKA_RESP_ERR__PARTITION_EOF event whenever the consumer reaches the end of a partition. defaults to true.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: enableIdempotence
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Producer only. When set to true, the producer will ensure that messages are successfully produced exactly once and in the original produce order. The following configuration properties are adjusted automatically (if not modified by the user) when idempotence is enabled: max.in.flight.requests.per.connection=5 (must be less than or equal to 5), retries=INT32_MAX (must be greater than 0), acks=all, queuing.strategy=fifo. Producer instantation will fail if user-supplied configuration is incompatible. Defaults to false.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: queueBufferingMaxMessages
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Producer only. Maximum number of messages allowed on the producer queue. This queue is shared by all topics and partitions. Defaults to 100000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: queueBufferingMaxKBytes
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Producer only. Maximum total message size sum allowed on the producer queue. This queue is shared by all topics and partitions. This property has higher priority than queue.buffering.max.messages. Defaults to 1048576.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: queueBufferingMaxMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Producer only. Delay in milliseconds to wait for messages in the producer queue to accumulate before constructing message batches (MessageSets) to transmit to brokers. A higher value allows larger and more effective (less overhead, improved compression) batches of messages to accumulate at the expense of increased message delivery latency. Defaults to 0.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: messageSendMaxRetries
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Producer only. How many times to retry sending a failing Message. Note: retrying may cause reordering unless enable.idempotence is set to true. Defaults to 2.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: requestRequiredAcks
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Producer only. This field indicates the number of acknowledgements the leader broker must receive from ISR brokers before responding to the request: 0=Broker does not send any response/ack to client, -1=Broker will block until message is committed by all in sync replicas (ISRs). Defaults to -1.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: requestTimeoutMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Producer only. The ack timeout of the producer request in milliseconds. This value is only enforced by the broker and relies on request.required.acks being != 0. Default 5000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: messageTimeoutMs
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Producer only. Local message timeout. This value is only enforced locally and limits the time a produced message waits for successful delivery. A time of 0 is infinite. This is the maximum time Kitura-Kafka may use to deliver a message (including retries). Delivery error occurs when either the retry count or the message timeout are exceeded. Defaults to 300000.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: autoOffsetReset
Classes/KafkaConfig.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Consumer only. Action to take when there is no initial offset in offset store or the desired offset is out of range: ‘smallest’,‘earliest’, ‘beginning’ - automatically reset the offset to the smallest offset, ‘largest’,‘latest’, ‘end’ - automatically reset the offset to the largest offset, ‘error’ - trigger an error which is retrieved by consuming message. Defaults to largest.

Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.name: AutoResetOptions
Classes/KafkaConfig/AutoResetOptions.htm.abstract: A struct representing the options actions to take when there is no initial offset in offset store or the desired offset is out of range.

Classes/KafkaClient.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: connect(brokers:)
Classes/KafkaClient.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Connect as a client to the servers (Kafka broker) at the provided addresses.

Classes/KafkaClient.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: connect(brokers:)
Classes/KafkaClient.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Connect as a client to the servers (Kafka broker) at the provided addresses.

Classes/KafkaClient.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.name: connect(brokers:)
Classes/KafkaClient.html#/s:10SwiftKafka.abstract: Connect as a client to the servers (Kafka broker) at the provided addresses.

Classes/KafkaClient.html.name: KafkaClient
Classes/KafkaClient.html.abstract: A class for clients that will connect to a Kafka server.

Classes/KafkaConfig.html.name: KafkaConfig
Classes/KafkaConfig.html.abstract: The configuration settings for a Kafka consumer/producer.

Classes/KafkaConsumer.html.name: KafkaConsumer
Classes/KafkaConsumer.html.abstract: A KafkaClient for consuming messages on a topic from a broker.

Classes/KafkaProducer.html.name: KafkaProducer
Classes/KafkaProducer.html.abstract: A threadsafe KafkaClient for producing messages to a topic on a broker.
